message:
If anybody wants to to use the community-driven http://jshint.com/ instead of JSLint:

1. Install the `jshint` node.js package using npm: `npm install jshint`
2. Check it's working by executing `jshint` from anywhere in your system.
3. Create a .jshintrc (note the dot) file in your HOME (~/) directory. Here's an example: https://github.com/oryband/dotfiles/blob/master/jshintrc - Note this isn't a standard JavaScript file, you can't use comments in here. Just switch true/false values according to your preference.
4. You'll need to overwrite Syntastic's syntax_checkers/javascript.vim file with this one: https://github.com/oryband/dotvim/blob/master/syntax_checkers/javascript.vim 

Have fun.

Spent a day turning my Vim to a JavaScript IDE. Here's how:

1. Install using the following packages using your favorite OS package-manager (apt-get, homebrew): `exuberant-ctags`, `jsl` (JSLint), `node` (Node.js)
2. Install the Node Package Manager (npm): `curl http://npmjs.org/install.sh | sh`
3. Clone `DoctorJS` from github: `git clone https://github.com/mozilla/doctorjs.git`
4. Go inside the DoctorJS folder and `make install` (You'll need the `make` app installed, but this is very basic).
5. Install the Syntastic Vim plugin: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2736
6. PROFIT. :)

Enjoy, kiddos.

Oh yeah, I forgot one last final important thing:

In order to have a correct function list, you also need the TagBar (not TagList!) Vim plugin: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=3465
There's a batteries-included jshint.vim fork of jslint.vim here: https://github.com/wookiehangover/jshint.vim
But I should give Syntastic a spin one of these days :-)

And also, I've posted thie whole explanation in an ordered manner here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/473478/vim-jslint/5893447#5893447

and also here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4777366/recommended-vim-plugins-for-javascript-coding/5893600#5893600

Thanks! But syntastic is really a general-use plugin that work with many syntax-checkers, so I prefer to work with it instead.

One thing I also forgot is that you need to put a .jshintrc config file in the $HOME directory. Here's my copy which you can start from: https://github.com/oryband/dotfiles/blob/master/jshintrc
Just a note, Syntastic doesn't work with MacVim because MacVim doesn't have 'balloon_eval'
Syntastic works fine for me w/ MacVim.  I use it with jslint and pyflakes...
